model: sig User { follows : set User, sees : set Photo, posts : set Photo, suggested : set User } sig Influencer extends User {} sig Photo { date : one Day } sig Ad extends Photo {} sig Day {}

requirements.description: Every photo is posted by one user
Users can see ads posted by everyone, but only see non ads posted by followed users
requirements.instances:
run Pos1 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1, D2 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        Influencer = U2
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P1
        Day = D1 + D2

        date = P1->D1 + P2->D2
        posts = U2->P1 + U2->P2
        follows = U1->U2
        sees = U1->P1 + U2->P1 + U1->P2
        no suggested
    }
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 2 Day expect 1 // Positive: all users see all ads (P1); the non-ad (P2) is only seen by U1 who follows its poster U2; every photo has exactly one poster; no self-follow.

run Pos2 {
    some disj U1, U2, U3 : User | some disj P1 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2 + U3
        Influencer = U3
        Photo = P1
        Ad = P1
        Day = D1

        date = P1->D1
        posts = U2->P1
        no follows
        sees = U1->P1 + U2->P1 + U3->P1
        no suggested
    }
} for 3 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: the only photo is an ad and is seen by everyone; every photo has exactly one poster; no self-follow.

run Pos3 {
    some disj U1 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1, D2 : Day {
        User = U1
        no Influencer
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P1
        Day = D1 + D2

        date = P1->D1 + P2->D2
        posts = U1->P1 + U1->P2
        no follows
        sees = U1->P1
        no suggested
    }
} for 1 User, 2 Photo, 2 Day expect 1 // Positive: the ad (P1) is seen; the non-ad (P2) is not seen since the user follows no one; every photo has exactly one poster; no self-follow.

run Neg1 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj P1 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        Influencer = U1
        Photo = P1
        Ad = P1
        Day = D1

        date = P1->D1
        posts = U1->P1
        no follows
        sees = U1->P1
        no suggested
    }
} for 2 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: U2 does not see the ad (P1), violating that every user should see all ads; every photo has exactly one poster; no self-follow.

run Neg2 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1, D2 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        no Influencer
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P1
        Day = D1 + D2

        date = P1->D1 + P2->D2
        posts = U2->P1 + U2->P2
        no follows
        sees = U1->P1 + U1->P2 + U2->P1
        no suggested
    }
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 2 Day expect 0 // Negative: U1 sees non-ad (P2) posted by U2 without following U2; ads are seen by everyone; every photo has exactly one poster; no self-follow.

run Neg3 {
    some disj U1 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1, D2 : Day {
        User = U1
        Influencer = U1
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P1
        Day = D1 + D2

        date = P1->D1 + P2->D2
        posts = U1->P1 + U1->P2
        no follows
        sees = U1->P1 + U1->P2
        no suggested
    }
} for 1 User, 2 Photo, 2 Day expect 0 // Negative: user sees a non-ad (P2) posted by themselves without following the poster (self-follow is forbidden), violating the visibility rule; every photo has exactly one poster; no self-follow.

requirements.description: If a user posts an ad then all its posts should be labeled as ads
Influencers are followed by everyone else
requirements.instances:
run Pos1 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        Influencer = U1
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P2
        follows = U2->U1
        posts = U1->P1 + U2->P2
        sees = U1->P2 + U2->P2 + U2->P1
        suggested = no suggested
        Day = D1
        date = P1->D1 + P2->D1
    }
} for 2 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: U1 is an Influencer and is followed by the only other user (U2). No self-follows. Every photo has exactly one poster. All users see all ads (P2), and non-ads (P1) are only seen by followers of the poster (U2 follows U1, so U2 sees P1). No user who posts an ad also posts a non-ad.

run Pos2 {
    some disj U1, U2, U3 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2 + U3
        Influencer = U1 + U2
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P1 + P2
        follows = U1->U2 + U2->U1 + U3->U1 + U3->U2
        posts = U1->P1 + U2->P2
        sees = U1->P1 + U1->P2 + U2->P1 + U2->P2 + U3->P1 + U3->P2
        suggested = no suggested
        Day = D1
        date = P1->D1 + P2->D1
    }
} for 3 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: Both Influencers (U1, U2) are followed by everyone else (including each other and U3). No self-follows. All photos are ads, so every user sees both. Each photo has exactly one poster, and ad-posters post only ads.

run Pos3 {
    some disj U1 : User | some disj P1 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1
        Influencer = U1
        Photo = P1
        Ad = no Ad
        follows = no follows
        posts = U1->P1
        sees = no sees
        suggested = no suggested
        Day = D1
        date = P1->D1
    }
} for 1 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: The sole user is an Influencer; there is no “everyone else,” so the condition holds vacuously. No self-follows. The single non-ad photo is posted by U1, and no non-ad is seen since U1 follows nobody; there are no ads.

run Neg1 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj P1 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        Influencer = U1
        Photo = P1
        Ad = P1
        follows = no follows
        posts = U1->P1
        sees = U1->P1 + U2->P1
        suggested = no suggested
        Day = D1
        date = P1->D1
    }
} for 2 User, 1 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: U1 is an Influencer but U2 does not follow U1. No self-follows. The ad is posted by U1 and is seen by both users, satisfying the ads rule; each photo has exactly one poster.

run Neg2 {
    some disj U1, U2, U3 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2 + U3
        Influencer = U1 + U2
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = P2
        follows = U3->U1
        posts = U1->P1 + U2->P2
        sees = U1->P2 + U2->P2 + U3->P2 + U3->P1
        suggested = no suggested
        Day = D1
        date = P1->D1 + P2->D1
    }
} for 3 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: U2 is an Influencer not followed by U3 (U3 follows only U1), so not every Influencer is followed by everyone else. No self-follows. All users see the ad (P2); only U3 sees the non-ad (P1) because it follows its poster (U1). Each photo has exactly one poster; the ad-poster (U2) posts only ads.

run Neg3 {
    some disj U1, U2, U3 : User | some disj P1, P2 : Photo | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2 + U3
        Influencer = U1
        Photo = P1 + P2
        Ad = no Ad
        follows = U2->U1
        posts = U2->P1 + U3->P2
        sees = no sees
        suggested = no suggested
        Day = D1
        date = P1->D1 + P2->D1
    }
} for 3 User, 2 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: U1 is an Influencer but U3 does not follow U1, so the requirement fails. No self-follows. There are no ads, and non-ads are only visible from followed users; since nobody follows the posters (U2 or U3), sees is empty. Each photo is posted by exactly one user.

requirements.description: Suggested are other users followed by followed users, but not yet followed
requirements.instances:
run Pos1 {
    some disj U1 : User | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1
        no Influencer
        no Photo
        no Ad
        Day = D1

        no follows
        no posts
        no sees
        no suggested
        no date
    }
} for 1 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: single user with no follows; there are no two-hop-followed users, so suggested must be empty and is.

run Pos2 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        no Influencer
        no Photo
        no Ad
        Day = D1

        follows = U1->U2
        no posts
        no sees
        no suggested
        no date
    }
} for 2 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: U1 follows U2, but U2 follows nobody; U1 has no two-hop candidates, so suggested is empty; all other constraints vacuously hold.

run Pos3 {
    some disj U1, U2, U3 : User | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2 + U3
        no Influencer
        no Photo
        no Ad
        Day = D1

        follows = U1->U2 + U2->U3
        suggested = U1->U3
        no posts
        no sees
        no date
    }
} for 3 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 1 // Positive: U1 follows U2 who follows U3; U1 is suggested U3 (two-hop, not yet followed, not self); others have no two-hop candidates.

run Neg1 {
    some disj U1 : User | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1
        no Influencer
        no Photo
        no Ad
        Day = D1

        no follows
        no posts
        no sees
        suggested = U1->U1
        no date
    }
} for 1 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: suggested includes the user themself, violating “other users”.

run Neg2 {
    some disj U1, U2 : User | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2
        no Influencer
        no Photo
        no Ad
        Day = D1

        follows = U1->U2
        no posts
        no sees
        suggested = U1->U2
        no date
    }
} for 2 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: U1 suggests U2 who is already followed, violating “but not yet followed”.

run Neg3 {
    some disj U1, U2, U3 : User | some disj D1 : Day {
        User = U1 + U2 + U3
        no Influencer
        no Photo
        no Ad
        Day = D1

        follows = U1->U2 + U2->U3
        no posts
        no sees
        no suggested
        no date
    }
} for 3 User, 0 Photo, 1 Day expect 0 // Negative: U1 should be suggested U3 (two-hop via U2) but suggested is empty, missing a required suggestion.

requirements.description: A user only sees ads from followed or suggested users

model: sig Workstation { workers : set Worker, succ : set Workstation } one sig begin, end in Workstation {} sig Worker {} sig Human, Robot extends Worker {} abstract sig Product { parts : set Product } sig Material extends Product {} sig Component extends Product { workstation : set Workstation } sig Dangerous in Product {}

requirements.description: Workers are either human or robots
requirements.instances:
run Pos1 {
    some disj WS1, WS2 : Workstation {
        Workstation = WS1 + WS2
        begin = WS1
        end = WS2
        no succ

        no Worker
        no workers
        no Human
        no Robot

        no Product
        no Material
        no Component
        no Dangerous
        no parts
        no workstation

        // Positive: there are no workers; vacuously, all workers (none) are either human or robots.
    }
} for 2 Workstation, 0 Worker, 0 Product expect 1

run Pos2 {
    some disj WS1, WS2 : Workstation | some disj W1 : Worker {
        Workstation = WS1 + WS2
        begin = WS1
        end = WS2
        succ = WS1->WS2

        Worker = W1
        Human = W1
        no Robot
        workers = WS1->W1

        no Product
        no Material
        no Component
        no Dangerous
        no parts
        no workstation

        // Positive: the only worker is a Human, so every worker is human or robot.
    }
} for 2 Workstation, 1 Worker, 0 Product expect 1

run Pos3 {
    some disj WS1, WS2 : Workstation | some disj W1 : Worker {
        Workstation = WS1 + WS2
        begin = WS1
        end = WS2
        succ = WS2->WS1

        Worker = W1
        Robot = W1
        no Human
        workers = WS2->W1

        no Product
        no Material
        no Component
        no Dangerous
        no parts
        no workstation

        // Positive: the only worker is a Robot, so every worker is human or robot.
    }
} for 2 Workstation, 1 Worker, 0 Product expect 1

run Neg1 {
    some disj WS1, WS2 : Workstation | some disj W1 : Worker {
        Workstation = WS1 + WS2
        begin = WS1
        end = WS2
        no succ

        Worker = W1
        no Human
        no Robot
        no workers

        no Product
        no Material
        no Component
        no Dangerous
        no parts
        no workstation

        // Negative: W1 is a Worker that is neither Human nor Robot, violating the requirement.
    }
} for 2 Workstation, 1 Worker, 0 Product expect 0

run Neg2 {
    some disj WS1, WS2 : Workstation | some disj W1 : Worker {
        Workstation = WS1 + WS2
        begin = WS1
        end = WS2
        succ = WS1->WS2 + WS2->WS1

        Worker = W1
        no Human
        no Robot
        workers = WS1->W1

        no Product
        no Material
        no Component
        no Dangerous
        no parts
        no workstation

        // Negative: there exists a Worker (W1) that is in neither Human nor Robot.
    }
} for 2 Workstation, 1 Worker, 0 Product expect 0

run Neg3 {
    some disj WS1, WS2 : Workstation | some disj W1, W2 : Worker {
        Workstation = WS1 + WS2
        begin = WS1
        end = WS2
        succ = WS1->WS2

        Worker = W1 + W2
        Human = W1
        no Robot
        workers = WS2->W1 + WS2->W2

        no Product
        no Material
        no Component
        no Dangerous
        no parts
        no workstation

        // Negative: W2 is a Worker that is neither Human nor Robot, so not all workers are human or robots.
    }
} for 2 Workstation, 2 Worker, 0 Product expect 0
